00070 void
00071 ExprStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00072     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00073         return;
00074 
00075     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00076     if (expr) 
00077         expr->GetValue(ctx);
00078 }

00119 /** Utility routine that emits code to initialize a symbol given an
00120     initializer expression.
00121 
00122     @param lvalue    Memory location of storage for the symbol's data
00123     @param symName   Name of symbol (used in error messages)
00124     @param type      Type of variable being initialized
00125     @param initExpr  Expression for the initializer
00126     @param ctx       FunctionEmitContext to use for generating instructions
00127     @param pos       Source file position of the variable being initialized
00128 */
00129 static void
00130 lInitSymbol(llvm::Value *lvalue, const char *symName, const Type *type, 
00131             Expr *initExpr, FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
00132     if (initExpr == NULL) {
00133         // Initialize things without initializers to the undefined value.
00134         // To auto-initialize everything to zero, replace 'UndefValue' with
00135         // 'NullValue' in the below
00136         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ltype = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
00137         ctx->StoreInst(llvm::UndefValue::get(ltype), lvalue);
00138         return;
00139     }
00140 
00141     // If the initializer is a straight up expression that isn't an
00142     // ExprList, then we'll see if we can type convert it to the type of
00143     // the variable.
00144     if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr) == NULL) {
00145         Expr *tcInit = initExpr->TypeConv(type, "inititalizer", true);
00146         if (tcInit != NULL) {
00147             llvm::Value *initializerValue = tcInit->GetValue(ctx);
00148             if (initializerValue != NULL)
00149                 // Bingo; store the value in the variable's storage
00150                 ctx->StoreInst(initializerValue, lvalue);
00151             return;
00152         }
00153     }
00154 
00155     // Atomic types and enums can't be initialized with { ... } initializer
00156     // expressions, so print an error and return if that's what we've got
00157     // here..
00158     if (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL ||
00159         dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
00160         if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr) != NULL)
00161             Error(initExpr->pos, "Expression list initializers can't be used for "
00162                   "variable \"%s\' with type \"%s\".", symName,
00163                   type->GetString().c_str());
00164         return;
00165     }
00166 
00167     const ReferenceType *rt = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type);
00168     if (rt) {
00169         if (!Type::Equal(initExpr->GetType(), rt)) {
00170             Error(initExpr->pos, "Initializer for reference type \"%s\" must have same "
00171                   "reference type itself. \"%s\" is incompatible.", 
00172                   rt->GetString().c_str(), initExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
00173             return;
00174         }
00175 
00176         llvm::Value *initializerValue = initExpr->GetValue(ctx);
00177         if (initializerValue)
00178             ctx->StoreInst(initializerValue, lvalue);
00179         return;
00180     }
00181 
00182     // There are two cases for initializing structs, arrays and vectors;
00183     // either a single initializer may be provided (float foo[3] = 0;), in
00184     // which case all of the elements are initialized to the given value,
00185     // or an initializer list may be provided (float foo[3] = { 1,2,3 }),
00186     // in which case the elements are initialized with the corresponding
00187     // values.
00188     const CollectionType *collectionType = 
00189         dynamic_cast<const CollectionType *>(type);
00190     if (collectionType != NULL) {
00191         std::string name;
00192         if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type) != NULL)
00193             name = "struct";
00194         else if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type) != NULL) 
00195             name = "array";
00196         else if (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type) != NULL) 
00197             name = "vector";
00198         else 
00199             FATAL("Unexpected CollectionType in lInitSymbol()");
00200 
00201         ExprList *exprList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr);
00202         if (exprList != NULL) {
00203             // The { ... } case; make sure we have the same number of
00204             // expressions in the ExprList as we have struct members
00205             int nInits = exprList->exprs.size();
00206             if (nInits != collectionType->GetElementCount()) {
00207                 Error(initExpr->pos, "Initializer for %s \"%s\" requires "
00208                       "%d values; %d provided.", name.c_str(), symName, 
00209                       collectionType->GetElementCount(), nInits);
00210                 return;
00211             }
00212 
00213             // Initialize each element with the corresponding value from
00214             // the ExprList
00215             for (int i = 0; i < nInits; ++i) {
00216                 llvm::Value *ep = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i, "element");
00217                 lInitSymbol(ep, symName, collectionType->GetElementType(i), 
00218                             exprList->exprs[i], ctx, pos);
00219             }
00220         }
00221         else
00222             Error(initExpr->pos, "Can't assign type \"%s\" to \"%s\".",
00223                   initExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
00224                   collectionType->GetString().c_str());
00225         return;
00226     }
00227 
00228     FATAL("Unexpected Type in lInitSymbol()");
00229 }
00230 
00231 
00232 void
00233 DeclStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00234     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00235         return;
00236 
00237     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declaration->declarators.size(); ++i) {
00238         Declarator *decl = declaration->declarators[i];
00239         if (!decl || decl->isFunction) 
00240             continue;
00241 
00242         Symbol *sym = decl->sym;
00243         assert(decl->sym != NULL);
00244         const Type *type = sym->type;
00245         if (!type)
00246             continue;
00247 
00248         // Now that we're in the thick of emitting code, it's easy for us
00249         // to find out the level of nesting of varying control flow we're
00250         // in at this declaration.  So we can finally set that
00251         // Symbol::varyingCFDepth variable.
00252         // @todo It's disgusting to be doing this here.
00253         sym->varyingCFDepth = ctx->VaryingCFDepth();
00254 
00255         ctx->SetDebugPos(sym->pos);
00256 
00257         // If it's an array that was declared without a size but has an
00258         // initializer list, then use the number of elements in the
00259         // initializer list to finally set the array's size.
00260         const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type);
00261         if (at && at->GetElementCount() == 0) {
00262             ExprList *exprList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(decl->initExpr);
00263             if (exprList) {
00264                 ArrayType *t = at->GetSizedArray(exprList->exprs.size());
00265                 assert(t != NULL);
00266                 sym->type = type = t;
00267             }
00268             else {
00269                 Error(sym->pos, "Can't declare an unsized array as a local "
00270                       "variable without providing an initializer expression to "
00271                       "set its size.");
00272                 continue;
00273             }
00274         }
00275 
00276         // References must have initializer expressions as well.
00277         if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type) && decl->initExpr == NULL) {
00278             Error(sym->pos,
00279                   "Must provide initializer for reference-type variable \"%s\".",
00280                   sym->name.c_str());
00281             continue;
00282         }
00283 
00284         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
00285         assert(llvmType != NULL);
00286 
00287         if (declaration->declSpecs->storageClass == SC_STATIC) {
00288             // For static variables, we need a compile-time constant value
00289             // for its initializer; if there's no initializer, we use a
00290             // zero value.
00291             llvm::Constant *cinit = NULL;
00292             if (decl->initExpr) {
00293                 cinit = decl->initExpr->GetConstant(type);
00294                 if (!cinit)
00295                     Error(sym->pos, "Initializer for static variable \"%s\" must be a constant.",
00296                           sym->name.c_str());
00297             }
00298             if (!cinit)
00299                 cinit = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
00300 
00301             // Allocate space for the static variable in global scope, so
00302             // that it persists across function calls
00303             sym->storagePtr =
00304                 new llvm::GlobalVariable(*m->module, llvmType, type->IsConstType(),
00305                                          llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage, cinit,
00306                                          llvm::Twine("static.") +
00307                                          llvm::Twine(sym->pos.first_line) + 
00308                                          llvm::Twine(".") + sym->name.c_str());
00309             // Tell the FunctionEmitContext about the variable 
00310             ctx->EmitVariableDebugInfo(sym);
00311         }
00312         else {
00313             // For non-static variables, allocate storage on the stack
00314             sym->storagePtr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmType, sym->name.c_str());
00315             // Tell the FunctionEmitContext about the variable; must do
00316             // this before the initializer stuff.
00317             ctx->EmitVariableDebugInfo(sym);
00318             // And then get it initialized...
00319             lInitSymbol(sym->storagePtr, sym->name.c_str(), type, decl->initExpr,
00320                         ctx, sym->pos);
00321         }
00322     }
00323 }
00324 
00325 
00326 Stmt *
00327 DeclStmt::Optimize() {
00328     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declaration->declarators.size(); ++i) {
00329         Declarator *decl = declaration->declarators[i];
00330         if (decl && decl->initExpr) {
00331             decl->initExpr = decl->initExpr->Optimize();
00332 
00333             // If the variable is const-qualified, after we've optimized
00334             // the initializer expression, see if we have a ConstExpr.  If
00335             // so, save it in Symbol::constValue where it can be used in
00336             // optimizing later expressions that have this symbol in them.
00337             // Note that there are cases where the expression may be
00338             // constant but where we don't have a ConstExpr; an example is
00339             // const arrays--the ConstExpr implementation just can't
00340             // represent an array of values.
00341             //
00342             // All this is fine in terms of the code that's generated in
00343             // the end (LLVM's constant folding stuff is good), but it
00344             // means that the ispc compiler's ability to reason about what
00345             // is definitely a compile-time constant for things like
00346             // computing array sizes from non-trivial expressions is
00347             // consequently limited.
00348             Symbol *sym = decl->sym;
00349             if (sym->type && sym->type->IsConstType() && decl->initExpr && 
00350                 dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(decl->initExpr) == NULL &&
00351                 Type::Equal(decl->initExpr->GetType(), sym->type))
00352                 sym->constValue = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(decl->initExpr);
00353         }
00354     }
00355     return this;
00356 }
00357 
00358 
00359 Stmt *
00360 DeclStmt::TypeCheck() {
00361     bool encounteredError = false;
00362     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declaration->declarators.size(); ++i) {
00363         Declarator *decl = declaration->declarators[i];
00364         if (!decl) {
00365             encounteredError = true;
00366             continue;
00367         }
00368 
00369         if (!decl->initExpr)
00370             continue;
00371         decl->initExpr = decl->initExpr->TypeCheck();
00372         if (!decl->initExpr)
00373             continue;
00374 
00375         // get the right type for stuff like const float foo = 2; so that
00376         // the int->float type conversion is in there and we don't return
00377         // an int as the constValue later...
00378         const Type *type = decl->sym->type;
00379         if (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL ||
00380             dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
00381             // If it's an expr list with an atomic type, we'll later issue
00382             // an error.  Need to leave decl->initExpr as is in that case so it
00383             // is in fact caught later, though.
00384             if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(decl->initExpr) == NULL)
00385                 decl->initExpr = decl->initExpr->TypeConv(type, "initializer");
00386         }
00387     }
00388     return encounteredError ? NULL : this;
00389 }

00398     printf("\n");
00399 }

00404 
00405 IfStmt::IfStmt(Expr *t, Stmt *ts, Stmt *fs, bool doUnif, SourcePos p) 
00406     : Stmt(p), test(t), trueStmts(ts), falseStmts(fs), 
00407       doCoherentCheck(doUnif && !g->opt.disableCoherentControlFlow) {
00408 }
00409 
00410 
00411 static void
00412 lEmitIfStatements(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, Stmt *stmts, const char *trueOrFalse) {
00413     if (!stmts)
00414         return;
00415 
00416     if (dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmts) == NULL)
00417         ctx->StartScope();
00418     ctx->AddInstrumentationPoint(trueOrFalse);
00419     stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
00420     if (dynamic_cast<const StmtList *>(stmts) == NULL)
00421         ctx->EndScope();
00422 }
00423 
00424 void
00425 IfStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00426     // First check all of the things that might happen due to errors
00427     // earlier in compilation and bail out if needed so that we don't
00428     // dereference NULL pointers in the below...
00429     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00430         return;
00431     if (!test) 
00432         return;
00433     const Type *testType = test->GetType();
00434     if (!testType)
00435         return;
00436 
00437     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00438     bool isUniform = testType->IsUniformType();
00439     if (isUniform) {
00440         ctx->StartUniformIf(ctx->GetMask());
00441         if (doCoherentCheck)
00442             Warning(test->pos, "Uniform condition supplied to cif statement.");
00443 
00444         // 'If' statements with uniform conditions are relatively
00445         // straightforward.  We evaluate the condition and then jump to
00446         // either the 'then' or 'else' clause depending on its value.
00447         llvm::Value *vtest = test->GetValue(ctx);
00448         if (vtest != NULL) {
00449             llvm::BasicBlock *bthen = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("if_then");
00450             llvm::BasicBlock *belse = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("if_else");
00451             llvm::BasicBlock *bexit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("if_exit");
00452 
00453             // Jump to the appropriate basic block based on the value of
00454             // the 'if' test
00455             ctx->BranchInst(bthen, belse, vtest);
00456 
00457             // Emit code for the 'true' case
00458             ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bthen);
00459             lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "true");
00460             if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00461                 ctx->BranchInst(bexit);
00462 
00463             // Emit code for the 'false' case
00464             ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(belse);
00465             lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "false");
00466             if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
00467                 ctx->BranchInst(bexit);
00468 
00469             // Set the active basic block to the newly-created exit block
00470             // so that subsequent emitted code starts there.
00471             ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bexit);
00472         }
00473         ctx->EndIf();
00474     }
00475     else {
00476         // Code for 'If' statemnts with 'varying' conditions can be
00477         // generated in two ways; one takes some care to see if all of the
00478         // active program instances want to follow only the 'true' or
00479         // 'false' cases, and the other always runs both cases but sets the
00480         // mask appropriately.  The first case is handled by the
00481         // IfStmt::emitCoherentTests() call, and the second is handled by
00482         // IfStmt::emitMaskedTrueAndFalse().
00483         llvm::Value *testValue = test->GetValue(ctx);
00484         if (testValue) {
00485             if (doCoherentCheck) 
00486                 emitCoherentTests(ctx, testValue);
00487             else {
00488                 llvm::Value *oldMask = ctx->GetMask();
00489                 ctx->StartVaryingIf(oldMask);
00490                 emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(ctx, oldMask, testValue);
00491                 ctx->EndIf();
00492             }
00493         }
00494     }
00495 }
00496 
00497 
00498 Stmt *
00499 IfStmt::Optimize() {
00500     if (test) 
00501         test = test->Optimize();
00502     if (trueStmts) 
00503         trueStmts = trueStmts->Optimize();
00504     if (falseStmts) 
00505         falseStmts = falseStmts->Optimize();
00506     return this;
00507 }
00508 
00509 
00510 Stmt *IfStmt::TypeCheck() {
00511     if (test) {
00512         test = test->TypeCheck();
00513         if (test) {
00514             const Type *testType = test->GetType();
00515             if (testType) {
00516                 bool isUniform = testType->IsUniformType() && !g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow;
00517                 if (!testType->IsNumericType() && !testType->IsBoolType()) {
00518                     Error(test->pos, "Type \"%s\" can't be converted to boolean for \"if\" test.",
00519                           testType->GetString().c_str());
00520                     return NULL;
00521                 }
00522                 test = new TypeCastExpr(isUniform ? AtomicType::UniformBool : 
00523                                         AtomicType::VaryingBool, 
00524                                         test, test->pos);
00525                 assert(test);
00526             }
00527         }
00528     }
00529     if (trueStmts)
00530         trueStmts = trueStmts->TypeCheck();
00531     if (falseStmts) 
00532         falseStmts = falseStmts->TypeCheck();
00533 
00534     return this;
00535 }
00536 
00537 
00538 void
00539 IfStmt::Print(int indent) const {
00540     printf("%*cIf Stmt %s", indent, ' ', doCoherentCheck ? "DO COHERENT CHECK" : "");
00541     pos.Print();
00542     printf("\n%*cTest: ", indent+4, ' ');
00543     test->Print();
00544     printf("\n");
00545     if (trueStmts) {
00546         printf("%*cTrue:\n", indent+4, ' ');
00547         trueStmts->Print(indent+8);
00548     }
00549     if (falseStmts) {
00550         printf("%*cFalse:\n", indent+4, ' ');
00551         falseStmts->Print(indent+8);
00552     }
00553 }
00554 
00555 
00556 /** Emit code to run both the true and false statements for the if test,
00557     with the mask set appropriately before runnign each one. 
00558 */
00559 void
00560 IfStmt::emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *oldMask, 
00561                                llvm::Value *test) const {
00562     if (trueStmts) {
00563         ctx->MaskAnd(oldMask, test);
00564         lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "if: expr mixed, true statements");
00565         // under varying control flow,, returns can't stop instruction
00566         // emission, so this better be non-NULL...
00567         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()); 
00568     }
00569     if (falseStmts) {
00570         ctx->MaskAndNot(oldMask, test);
00571         lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "if: expr mixed, false statements");
00572         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00573     }
00574 }
00575 
00576 
00577 /** Emit code for an if test that checks the mask and the test values and
00578     tries to be smart about jumping over code that doesn't need to be run.
00579  */
00580 void
00581 IfStmt::emitCoherentTests(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *ltest) const {
00582     llvm::Value *oldMask = ctx->GetMask();
00583     if (oldMask == LLVMMaskAllOn) {
00584         // We can tell that the mask is on statically at compile time; just
00585         // emit code for the 'if test with the mask all on' path
00586         llvm::BasicBlock *bDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_done");
00587         emitMaskAllOn(ctx, ltest, bDone);
00588         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bDone);
00589     }
00590     else {
00591         // We can't tell if the mask going into the if is all on at the
00592         // compile time.  Emit code to check for this and then either run
00593         // the code for the 'all on' or the 'mixed' case depending on the
00594         // mask's value at runtime.
00595         llvm::BasicBlock *bAllOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mask_all");
00596         llvm::BasicBlock *bMixedOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mask_mixed");
00597         llvm::BasicBlock *bDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_done");
00598 
00599         // Jump to either bAllOn or bMixedOn, depending on the mask's value 
00600         llvm::Value *maskAllQ = ctx->All(oldMask);
00601         ctx->BranchInst(bAllOn, bMixedOn, maskAllQ);
00602 
00603         // Emit code for the 'mask all on' case
00604         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bAllOn);
00605         // We start by explicitly storing "all on" into the mask mask.
00606         // Note that this doesn't change its actual value, but doing so
00607         // lets the compiler see what's going on so that subsequent
00608         // optimizations for code emitted here can operate with the
00609         // knowledge that the mask is definitely all on (until it modifies
00610         // the mask itself).
00611         ctx->SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00612         emitMaskAllOn(ctx, ltest, bDone);
00613         
00614         // And emit code for the mixed mask case
00615         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bMixedOn);
00616         emitMaskMixed(ctx, oldMask, ltest, bDone);
00617 
00618         // When done, set the current basic block to the block that the two
00619         // paths above jump to when they're done.
00620         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bDone);
00621     }
00622 }
00623 
00624 
00625 /** Emits code for 'if' tests under the case where we know that the program
00626     mask is all on.
00627  */
00628 void
00629 IfStmt::emitMaskAllOn(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *ltest, 
00630                       llvm::BasicBlock *bDone) const {
00631     // First, check the value of the test.  If it's all on, then we jump to
00632     // a basic block that will only have code for the true case.
00633     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestAll = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_all");
00634     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestNoneCheck = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_none_check");
00635     llvm::Value *testAllQ = ctx->All(ltest);
00636     ctx->BranchInst(bTestAll, bTestNoneCheck, testAllQ);
00637 
00638     // Emit code for the 'test is all true' case
00639     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestAll);
00640     ctx->StartVaryingIf(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00641     lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "if: all on mask, expr all true");
00642     ctx->EndIf();
00643     if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock() != NULL)
00644         // bblock may legitimately be NULL since if there's a return stmt
00645         // or break or continue we can actually jump and end emission since
00646         // we know all of the lanes are following this path...
00647         ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00648 
00649     // The test isn't all true.  Now emit code to determine if it's all
00650     // false, or has mixed values.
00651     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestNoneCheck);
00652     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestNone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_none");
00653     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestMixed = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_test_mixed");
00654     llvm::Value *testMixedQ = ctx->Any(ltest);
00655     ctx->BranchInst(bTestMixed, bTestNone, testMixedQ);
00656 
00657     // Emit code for the 'test is all false' case
00658     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestNone);
00659     ctx->StartVaryingIf(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00660     lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "if: all on mask, expr all false");
00661     ctx->EndIf();
00662     if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
00663         // bblock may be NULL since if there's a return stmt or break or
00664         // continue we can actually jump or whatever and end emission...
00665         ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00666 
00667     // Finally emit code for the 'mixed true/false' case.  We unavoidably
00668     // need to run both the true and the false statements.
00669     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestMixed);
00670     ctx->StartVaryingIf(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00671     emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(ctx, LLVMMaskAllOn, ltest);
00672     // In this case, return/break/continue isn't allowed to jump and end
00673     // emission.
00674     assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00675     ctx->EndIf();
00676     ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00677 }
00678 
00679 
00680 /** Emits code that checks to see if for all of the lanes where the mask is
00681     on, the test has the value true.
00682  */
00683 static llvm::Value *
00684 lTestMatchesMask(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *test, llvm::Value *mask) {
00685     llvm::Value *testAndMask = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, test,
00686                                                    mask, "test&mask");
00687     return ctx->MasksAllEqual(testAndMask, mask);
00688 }
00689 
00690 
00691 /** Emit code for an 'if' test where the lane mask is known to be mixed
00692     on/off going into it.
00693  */
00694 void
00695 IfStmt::emitMaskMixed(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *oldMask, 
00696                       llvm::Value *ltest, llvm::BasicBlock *bDone) const {
00697     // First, see if, for all of the lanes where the mask is on, if the
00698     // value of the test is on.  (i.e. (test&mask) == mask).  In this case,
00699     // we only need to run the 'true' case code, since the lanes where the
00700     // test was false aren't supposed to be running here anyway.
00701      llvm::Value *testAllEqual = lTestMatchesMask(ctx, ltest, oldMask);
00702     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestAll = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mixed_test_all");
00703     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestAnyCheck = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mixed_test_any_check");
00704     ctx->BranchInst(bTestAll, bTestAnyCheck, testAllEqual);
00705 
00706     // Emit code for the (test&mask)==mask case.  Not only do we only need
00707     // to emit code for the true statements, but we don't need to modify
00708     // the mask's value; it's already correct.
00709     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestAll);
00710     ctx->StartVaryingIf(ctx->GetMask());
00711     lEmitIfStatements(ctx, trueStmts, "cif: all running lanes want just true stmts");
00712     assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00713     ctx->EndIf();
00714     ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00715 
00716     // Next, see if the active lanes only need to run the false case--i.e. if
00717     // (~test & mask) == mask.
00718     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestAnyCheck);
00719     llvm::Value *notTest = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Xor, LLVMMaskAllOn,
00720                                                ltest, "~test");
00721     llvm::Value *notMatchesMask = lTestMatchesMask(ctx, notTest, oldMask);
00722     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestAllNot = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mixed_test_none");
00723     llvm::BasicBlock *bTestMixed = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("cif_mixed_test_mixed");
00724     ctx->BranchInst(bTestAllNot, bTestMixed, notMatchesMask);
00725 
00726     // Emit code for the (~test & mask) == mask case.  We only need the
00727     // 'false' statements and again don't need to modify the value of the
00728     // mask.
00729     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestAllNot);
00730     ctx->StartVaryingIf(ctx->GetMask());
00731     lEmitIfStatements(ctx, falseStmts, "cif: all running lanes want just false stmts");
00732     assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00733     ctx->EndIf();
00734     ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00735 
00736     // It's mixed; we need to run both the true and false cases and also do
00737     // mask update stuff.
00738     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bTestMixed);
00739     ctx->StartVaryingIf(ctx->GetMask());
00740     emitMaskedTrueAndFalse(ctx, oldMask, ltest);
00741     ctx->EndIf();
00742     ctx->BranchInst(bDone);
00743 }
00744 
00745 
00746 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00747 // DoStmt
00748 
00749 /** Given a statment, walk through it to see if there is a 'break' or
00750     'continue' statement inside if its children, under varying control
00751     flow.  We need to detect this case for loops since what might otherwise
00752     look like a 'uniform' loop needs to have code emitted to do all of the
00753     lane management stuff if this is the case.
00754  */ 
00755 static bool
00756 lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(Stmt *stmt, bool inVaryingCF = false) {
00757     StmtList *sl;
00758     IfStmt *is;
00759 
00760     if ((sl = dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmt)) != NULL) {
00761         // Recurse through the children statements 
00762         const std::vector<Stmt *> &stmts = sl->GetStatements();
00763         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < stmts.size(); ++i)
00764             if (lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(stmts[i], inVaryingCF))
00765                 return true;
00766     }
00767     else if ((is = dynamic_cast<IfStmt *>(stmt)) != NULL) {
00768         // We've come to an 'if'.  Is the test type varying?  If so, then
00769         // we're under 'varying' control flow when we recurse through the
00770         // true and false statements.
00771         if (is->test != NULL) {
00772             const Type *type = is->test->GetType();
00773             if (type)
00774                 inVaryingCF |= type->IsVaryingType();
00775         }
00776 
00777         if (lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(is->trueStmts, inVaryingCF) ||
00778             lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(is->falseStmts, inVaryingCF))
00779             return true;
00780     }
00781     else if (dynamic_cast<BreakStmt *>(stmt) != NULL) {
00782         if (inVaryingCF)
00783             return true;
00784     }
00785     else if (dynamic_cast<ContinueStmt *>(stmt) != NULL) {
00786         if (inVaryingCF)
00787             return true;
00788     }
00789     // Important: note that we don't recurse into do/for loops here but
00790     // just return false.  For the question of whether a given loop needs
00791     // to do mask management stuff, breaks/continues inside nested loops
00792     // inside of them don't matter.
00793     return false;
00794 }
00795 
00796 
00797 DoStmt::DoStmt(Expr *t, Stmt *s, bool cc, SourcePos p) 
00798     : Stmt(p), testExpr(t), bodyStmts(s), 
00799       doCoherentCheck(cc && !g->opt.disableCoherentControlFlow) {
00800 }
00801 
00802 
00803 void DoStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00804     // Check for things that could be NULL due to earlier errors during
00805     // compilation.
00806     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00807         return;
00808     if (!testExpr || !testExpr->GetType()) 
00809         return;
00810 
00811     bool uniformTest = testExpr->GetType()->IsUniformType();
00812     if (uniformTest && doCoherentCheck)
00813         Warning(pos, "Uniform condition supplied to \"cdo\" statement.");
00814 
00815     llvm::BasicBlock *bloop = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_loop");
00816     llvm::BasicBlock *bexit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_exit");
00817     llvm::BasicBlock *btest = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_test");
00818 
00819     ctx->StartLoop(bexit, btest, uniformTest, ctx->GetMask());
00820 
00821     // Start by jumping into the loop body
00822     ctx->BranchInst(bloop);
00823 
00824     // And now emit code for the loop body
00825     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bloop);
00826     ctx->SetLoopMask(ctx->GetMask());
00827     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00828     // FIXME: in the StmtList::EmitCode() method takes starts/stops a new
00829     // scope around the statements in the list.  So if the body is just a
00830     // single statement (and thus not a statement list), we need a new
00831     // scope, but we don't want two scopes in the StmtList case.
00832     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(bodyStmts))
00833         ctx->StartScope();
00834 
00835     ctx->AddInstrumentationPoint("do loop body");
00836     if (doCoherentCheck && !uniformTest) {
00837         // Check to see if the mask is all on
00838         llvm::BasicBlock *bAllOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_all_on");
00839         llvm::BasicBlock *bMixed = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("do_mixed");
00840         ctx->BranchIfMaskAll(bAllOn, bMixed);
00841 
00842         // If so, emit code for the 'mask all on' case.  In particular,
00843         // explicitly set the mask to 'all on' (see rationale in
00844         // IfStmt::emitCoherentTests()), and then emit the code for the
00845         // loop body.
00846         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bAllOn);
00847         ctx->SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOn);
00848         if (bodyStmts)
00849             bodyStmts->EmitCode(ctx);
00850         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00851         ctx->BranchInst(btest);
00852 
00853         // The mask is mixed.  Just emit the code for the loop body.
00854         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bMixed);
00855         if (bodyStmts)
00856             bodyStmts->EmitCode(ctx);
00857         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
00858         ctx->BranchInst(btest);
00859     }
00860     else {
00861         // Otherwise just emit the code for the loop body.  The current
00862         // mask is good.
00863         if (bodyStmts)
00864             bodyStmts->EmitCode(ctx);
00865         if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
00866             ctx->BranchInst(btest);
00867     }
00868     // End the scope we started above, if needed.
00869     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(bodyStmts))
00870         ctx->EndScope();
00871 
00872     // Now emit code for the loop test.
00873     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(btest);
00874     // First, emit code to restore the mask value for any lanes that
00875     // executed a 'continue' during the current loop before we go and emit
00876     // the code for the test.  This is only necessary for varying loops;
00877     // 'uniform' loops just jump when they hit a continue statement and
00878     // don't mess with the mask.
00879     if (!uniformTest)
00880         ctx->RestoreContinuedLanes();
00881     llvm::Value *testValue = testExpr->GetValue(ctx);
00882     if (!testValue)
00883         return;
00884 
00885     if (uniformTest)
00886         // For the uniform case, just jump to the top of the loop or the
00887         // exit basic block depending on the value of the test.
00888         ctx->BranchInst(bloop, bexit, testValue);
00889     else {
00890         // For the varying case, update the mask based on the value of the
00891         // test.  If any program instances still want to be running, jump
00892         // to the top of the loop.  Otherwise, jump out.
00893         llvm::Value *mask = ctx->GetMask();
00894         ctx->MaskAnd(mask, testValue);
00895         ctx->BranchIfMaskAny(bloop, bexit);
00896     }
00897 
00898     // ...and we're done.  Set things up for subsequent code to be emitted
00899     // in the right basic block.
00900     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bexit);
00901     ctx->EndLoop();
00902 }
00903 
00904 
00905 Stmt *
00906 DoStmt::Optimize() {
00907     if (testExpr) 
00908         testExpr = testExpr->Optimize();
00909     if (bodyStmts) 
00910         bodyStmts = bodyStmts->Optimize();
00911     return this;
00912 }
00913 
00914 
00915 Stmt *
00916 DoStmt::TypeCheck() {
00917     if (testExpr) {
00918         testExpr = testExpr->TypeCheck();
00919         if (testExpr) {
00920             const Type *testType = testExpr->GetType();
00921             if (testType) {
00922                 if (!testType->IsNumericType() && !testType->IsBoolType()) {
00923                     Error(testExpr->pos, "Type \"%s\" can't be converted to boolean for \"while\" "
00924                           "test in \"do\" loop.", testExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
00925                     return NULL;
00926                 }
00927 
00928                 // Should the test condition for the loop be uniform or
00929                 // varying?  It can be uniform only if three conditions are
00930                 // met.  First and foremost, the type of the test condition
00931                 // must be uniform.  Second, the user must not have set the
00932                 // dis-optimization option that disables uniform flow
00933                 // control.
00934                 //
00935                 // Thirdly, and most subtlely, there must not be any break
00936                 // or continue statements inside the loop that are within
00937                 // the scope of a 'varying' if statement.  If there are,
00938                 // then we type cast the test to be 'varying', so that the
00939                 // code generated for the loop includes masking stuff, so
00940                 // that we can track which lanes actually want to be
00941                 // running, accounting for breaks/continues.
00942                 bool uniformTest = (testType->IsUniformType() &&
00943                                     !g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow &&
00944                                     !lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(bodyStmts));
00945                 testExpr = new TypeCastExpr(uniformTest ? AtomicType::UniformBool :
00946                                                           AtomicType::VaryingBool,
00947                                             testExpr, testExpr->pos);
00948             }
00949         }
00950     }
00951 
00952     if (bodyStmts) 
00953         bodyStmts = bodyStmts->TypeCheck();
00954     return this;
00955 }
00956 
00957 
00958 void
00959 DoStmt::Print(int indent) const {
00960     printf("%*cDo Stmt", indent, ' ');
00961     pos.Print();
00962     printf(":\n");
00963     printf("%*cTest: ", indent+4, ' ');
00964     if (testExpr) testExpr->Print();
00965     printf("\n");
00966     if (bodyStmts) {
00967         printf("%*cStmts:\n", indent+4, ' ');
00968         bodyStmts->Print(indent+8);
00969     }
00970 }
00971 
00972 
00973 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00974 // ForStmt
00975 
00976 ForStmt::ForStmt(Stmt *i, Expr *t, Stmt *s, Stmt *st, bool cc, SourcePos p) 
00977     : Stmt(p), init(i), test(t), step(s), stmts(st), 
00978       doCoherentCheck(cc && !g->opt.disableCoherentControlFlow) {
00979 }
00980 
00981 
00982 void
00983 ForStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00984     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
00985         return;
00986 
00987     llvm::BasicBlock *btest = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_test");
00988     llvm::BasicBlock *bstep = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_step");
00989     llvm::BasicBlock *bloop = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_loop");
00990     llvm::BasicBlock *bexit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_exit");
00991 
00992     bool uniformTest = test ? test->GetType()->IsUniformType() :
00993         (!g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow &&
00994          !lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(stmts));
00995 
00996     ctx->StartLoop(bexit, bstep, uniformTest, ctx->GetMask());
00997     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00998 
00999     // If we have an initiailizer statement, start by emitting the code for
01000     // it and then jump into the loop test code.  (Also start a new scope
01001     // since the initiailizer may be a declaration statement).
01002     if (init) {
01003         assert(dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(init) == NULL);
01004         ctx->StartScope();
01005         init->EmitCode(ctx);
01006     }
01007     ctx->BranchInst(btest);
01008 
01009     assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
01010 #if 0
01011     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) {
01012         // when does this happen??
01013         if (init)
01014             ctx->EndScope();
01015         ctx->EndLoop();
01016         return;
01017     }
01018 #endif
01019 
01020     // Emit code to get the value of the loop test.  If no test expression
01021     // was provided, just go with a true value.
01022     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(btest);
01023     llvm::Value *ltest = NULL;
01024     if (test) {
01025         ltest = test->GetValue(ctx);
01026         if (!ltest) {
01027             ctx->EndScope();
01028             ctx->EndLoop();
01029             return;
01030         }
01031     }
01032     else
01033         ltest = uniformTest ? LLVMTrue : LLVMBoolVector(true);
01034 
01035     // Now use the test's value.  For a uniform loop, we can either jump to
01036     // the loop body or the loop exit, based on whether it's true or false.
01037     // For a non-uniform loop, we update the mask and jump into the loop if
01038     // any of the mask values are true.
01039     if (uniformTest) {
01040         if (doCoherentCheck)
01041             Warning(pos, "Uniform condition supplied to cfor/cwhile statement.");
01042         assert(ltest->getType() == LLVMTypes::BoolType);
01043         ctx->BranchInst(bloop, bexit, ltest);
01044     }
01045     else {
01046         llvm::Value *mask = ctx->GetMask();
01047         ctx->MaskAnd(mask, ltest);
01048         ctx->BranchIfMaskAny(bloop, bexit);
01049     }
01050 
01051     // On to emitting the code for the loop body.
01052     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bloop);
01053     ctx->SetLoopMask(ctx->GetMask());
01054     ctx->AddInstrumentationPoint("for loop body");
01055     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmts))
01056         ctx->StartScope();
01057 
01058     if (doCoherentCheck && !uniformTest) {
01059         // For 'varying' loops with the coherence check, we start by
01060         // checking to see if the mask is all on, after it has been updated
01061         // based on the value of the test.
01062         llvm::BasicBlock *bAllOn = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_all_on");
01063         llvm::BasicBlock *bMixed = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("for_mixed");
01064         ctx->BranchIfMaskAll(bAllOn, bMixed);
01065 
01066         // Emit code for the mask being all on.  Explicitly set the mask to
01067         // be on so that the optimizer can see that it's on (i.e. now that
01068         // the runtime test has passed, make this fact clear for code
01069         // generation at compile time here.)
01070         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bAllOn);
01071         ctx->SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOn);
01072         if (stmts)
01073             stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01074         assert(ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
01075         ctx->BranchInst(bstep);
01076 
01077         // Emit code for the mask being mixed.  We should never run the
01078         // loop with the mask all off, based on the BranchIfMaskAny call
01079         // above.
01080         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bMixed);
01081         if (stmts)
01082             stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01083         ctx->BranchInst(bstep);
01084     }
01085     else {
01086         // For both uniform loops and varying loops without the coherence
01087         // check, we know that at least one program instance wants to be
01088         // running the loop, so just emit code for the loop body and jump
01089         // to the loop step code.
01090         if (stmts)
01091             stmts->EmitCode(ctx);
01092         if (ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock())
01093             ctx->BranchInst(bstep);
01094     }
01095     if (!dynamic_cast<StmtList *>(stmts))
01096         ctx->EndScope();
01097 
01098     // Emit code for the loop step.  First, restore the lane mask of any
01099     // program instances that executed a 'continue' during the previous
01100     // iteration.  Then emit code for the loop step and then jump to the
01101     // test code.
01102     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bstep);
01103     ctx->RestoreContinuedLanes();
01104     if (step)
01105         step->EmitCode(ctx);
01106     ctx->BranchInst(btest);
01107 
01108     // Set the current emission basic block to the loop exit basic block
01109     ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bexit);
01110     if (init)
01111         ctx->EndScope();
01112     ctx->EndLoop();
01113 }
01114 
01115 
01116 Stmt *
01117 ForStmt::Optimize() {
01118     if (test) 
01119         test = test->Optimize();
01120     if (init) 
01121         init = init->Optimize();
01122     if (step) 
01123         step = step->Optimize();
01124     if (stmts) 
01125         stmts = stmts->Optimize();
01126     return this;
01127 }
01128 
01129 
01130 Stmt *
01131 ForStmt::TypeCheck() {
01132     if (test) {
01133         test = test->TypeCheck();
01134         if (test) {
01135             const Type *testType = test->GetType();
01136             if (testType) {
01137                 if (!testType->IsNumericType() && !testType->IsBoolType()) {
01138                     Error(test->pos, "Type \"%s\" can't be converted to boolean for for loop test.",
01139                           test->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
01140                     return NULL;
01141                 }
01142 
01143                 // See comments in DoStmt::TypeCheck() regarding
01144                 // 'uniformTest' and the type cast here.
01145                 bool uniformTest = (testType->IsUniformType() &&
01146                                     !g->opt.disableUniformControlFlow &&
01147                                     !lHasVaryingBreakOrContinue(stmts));
01148                 test = new TypeCastExpr(uniformTest ? AtomicType::UniformBool :
01149                                                       AtomicType::VaryingBool,
01150                                         test, test->pos);
01151             }
01152         }
01153     }
01154 
01155     if (init) 
01156         init = init->TypeCheck();
01157     if (step) 
01158         step = step->TypeCheck();
01159     if (stmts) 
01160         stmts = stmts->TypeCheck();
01161     return this;
01162 }
01163 
01164 
01165 void
01166 ForStmt::Print(int indent) const {
01167     printf("%*cFor Stmt", indent, ' ');
01168     pos.Print();
01169     printf("\n");
01170     if (init) {
01171         printf("%*cInit:\n", indent+4, ' ');
01172         init->Print(indent+8);
01173     }
01174     if (test) {
01175         printf("%*cTest: ", indent+4, ' ');
01176         test->Print();
01177         printf("\n");
01178     }
01179     if (step) {
01180         printf("%*cStep:\n", indent+4, ' ');
01181         step->Print(indent+8);
01182     }
01183     if (stmts) {
01184         printf("%*cStmts:\n", indent+4, ' ');
01185         stmts->Print(indent+8);
01186     }
01187 }
01188 
01189 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01190 // BreakStmt
01191 
01192 BreakStmt::BreakStmt(bool cc, SourcePos p) 
01193     : Stmt(p), doCoherenceCheck(cc && !g->opt.disableCoherentControlFlow) {
01194 }
01195 
01196 
01197 void
01198 BreakStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01199     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
01200         return;
01201 
01202     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01203     ctx->Break(doCoherenceCheck);
01204 }
01205

01209     return this;
01210 }

01223     printf("\n");
01224 }

01315 
01316 void
01317 StmtList::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01318     if (!ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock()) 
01319         return;
01320 
01321     ctx->StartScope();
01322     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01323     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < stmts.size(); ++i)
01324         if (stmts[i])
01325             stmts[i]->EmitCode(ctx);
01326     ctx->EndScope();
01327 }
01328

01330 Stmt *
01331 StmtList::Optimize() {
01332     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < stmts.size(); ++i)
01333         if (stmts[i])
01334             stmts[i] = stmts[i]->Optimize();
01335     return this;
01336 }

01342         if (stmts[i])
01343             stmts[i] = stmts[i]->TypeCheck();
01344     return this;

01349 StmtList::Print(int indent) const {
01350     printf("%*cStmt List", indent, ' ');
01351     pos.Print();

01353     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < stmts.size(); ++i)
01354         if (stmts[i])
01355             stmts[i]->Print(indent+4);

01358 
01359 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01360 // PrintStmt
01361 
01362 PrintStmt::PrintStmt(const std::string &f, Expr *v, SourcePos p) 
01363     : Stmt(p), format(f), values(v) {
01364 }
01365 
01366 /* Because the pointers to values that are passed to __do_print() are all
01367    void *s (and because ispc print() formatting strings statements don't
01368    encode types), we pass along a string to __do_print() where the i'th
01369    character encodes the type of the i'th value to be printed.  Needless to
01370    say, the encoding chosen here and the decoding code in __do_print() need
01371    to agree on the below!
01372  */
01373 static char
01374 lEncodeType(const Type *t) {
01375     if (t == AtomicType::UniformBool)   return 'b';
01376     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingBool)   return 'B';
01377     if (t == AtomicType::UniformInt32)  return 'i';
01378     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingInt32)  return 'I';
01379     if (t == AtomicType::UniformUInt32) return 'u';
01380     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingUInt32) return 'U';
01381     if (t == AtomicType::UniformFloat)  return 'f';
01382     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingFloat)  return 'F';
01383     if (t == AtomicType::UniformInt64)  return 'l';
01384     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingInt64)  return 'L';
01385     if (t == AtomicType::UniformUInt64) return 'v';
01386     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingUInt64) return 'V';
01387     if (t == AtomicType::UniformDouble) return 'd';
01388     if (t == AtomicType::VaryingDouble) return 'D';
01389     else return '\0';
01390 }
01391 
01392 
01393 /** Given an Expr for a value to be printed, emit the code to evaluate the
01394     expression and store the result to alloca'd memory.  Update the
01395     argTypes string with the type encoding for this expression.
01396  */
01397 static llvm::Value *
01398 lProcessPrintArg(Expr *expr, FunctionEmitContext *ctx, std::string &argTypes) {
01399     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
01400     if (type == NULL)
01401         return NULL;
01402 
01403     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type) != NULL) {
01404         expr = new DereferenceExpr(expr, expr->pos);
01405         type = expr->GetType();
01406         if (type == NULL)
01407             return NULL;
01408     }
01409 
01410     // Just int8 and int16 types to int32s...
01411     const Type *baseType = type->GetAsNonConstType()->GetAsUniformType();
01412     if (baseType == AtomicType::UniformInt8 ||
01413         baseType == AtomicType::UniformUInt8 ||
01414         baseType == AtomicType::UniformInt16 ||
01415         baseType == AtomicType::UniformUInt16) {
01416         expr = new TypeCastExpr(type->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformInt32 :
01417                                                         AtomicType::VaryingInt32, 
01418                                 expr, expr->pos);
01419         type = expr->GetType();
01420     }
01421         
01422     char t = lEncodeType(type->GetAsNonConstType());
01423     if (t == '\0') {
01424         Error(expr->pos, "Only atomic types are allowed in print statements; "
01425               "type \"%s\" is illegal.", type->GetString().c_str());
01426         return NULL;
01427     }
01428     else {
01429         argTypes.push_back(t);
01430 
01431         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmExprType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
01432         llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmExprType, "print_arg");
01433         llvm::Value *val = expr->GetValue(ctx);
01434         if (!val)
01435             return NULL;
01436         ctx->StoreInst(val, ptr);
01437 
01438         ptr = ctx->BitCastInst(ptr, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
01439         return ptr;
01440     }
01441 }
01442 
01443 
01444 /* PrintStmt works closely with the __do_print() function implemented in
01445    the builtins-c.c file.  In particular, the EmitCode() method here needs to
01446    take the arguments passed to it from ispc and generate a valid call to
01447    __do_print() with the information that __do_print() then needs to do the
01448    actual printing work at runtime.
01449  */
01450 void
01451 PrintStmt::EmitCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01452     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01453 
01454     // __do_print takes 5 arguments; we'll get them stored in the args[] array
01455     // in the code emitted below
01456     //
01457     // 1. the format string
01458     // 2. a string encoding the types of the values being printed, 
01459     //    one character per value
01460     // 3. the number of running program instances (i.e. the target's
01461     //    vector width)
01462     // 4. the current lane mask
01463     // 5. a pointer to an array of pointers to the values to be printed
01464     llvm::Value *args[5];
01465     std::string argTypes;
01466 
01467     if (values == NULL)
01468         args[4] = NULL;
01469     else {
01470         // Get the values passed to the print() statement evaluated and
01471         // stored in memory so that we set up the array of pointers to them
01472         // for the 5th __do_print() argument
01473         ExprList *elist = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(values);
01474         int nArgs = elist ? elist->exprs.size() : 1;
01475 
01476         // Allocate space for the array of pointers to values to be printed 
01477         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *argPtrArrayType = 
01478             llvm::ArrayType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, nArgs);
01479         llvm::Value *argPtrArray = ctx->AllocaInst(argPtrArrayType,
01480                                                    "print_arg_ptrs");
01481         // Store the array pointer as a void **, which is what __do_print()
01482         // expects
01483         args[4] = ctx->BitCastInst(argPtrArray, 
01484                                    llvm::PointerType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, 0));
01485 
01486         // Now, for each of the arguments, emit code to evaluate its value
01487         // and store the value into alloca'd storage.  Then store the
01488         // pointer to the alloca'd storage into argPtrArray.
01489         if (elist) {
01490             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elist->exprs.size(); ++i) {
01491                 Expr *expr = elist->exprs[i];
01492                 if (!expr)
01493                     return;
01494                 llvm::Value *ptr = lProcessPrintArg(expr, ctx, argTypes);
01495                 if (!ptr)
01496                     return;
01497 
01498                 llvm::Value *arrayPtr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(argPtrArray, 0, i);
01499                 ctx->StoreInst(ptr, arrayPtr);
01500             }
01501         }
01502         else {
01503             llvm::Value *ptr = lProcessPrintArg(values, ctx, argTypes);
01504             if (!ptr)
01505                 return;
01506             llvm::Value *arrayPtr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(argPtrArray, 0, 0);
01507             ctx->StoreInst(ptr, arrayPtr);
01508         }
01509     }
01510 
01511     // Now we can emit code to call __do_print()
01512     llvm::Function *printFunc = m->module->getFunction("__do_print");
01513     assert(printFunc);
01514 
01515     // Set up the rest of the parameters to it
01516     args[0] = ctx->GetStringPtr(format);
01517     args[1] = ctx->GetStringPtr(argTypes);
01518     args[2] = LLVMInt32(g->target.vectorWidth);
01519     args[3] = ctx->LaneMask(ctx->GetMask());
01520     std::vector<llvm::Value *> argVec(&args[0], &args[5]);
01521     ctx->CallInst(printFunc, argVec, "");
01522 }
01523 
01524 
01525 void
01526 PrintStmt::Print(int indent) const {
01527     printf("%*cPrint Stmt (%s)", indent, ' ', format.c_str());
01528 }
01529

01532 PrintStmt::Optimize() {
01533     if (values) 
01534         values = values->Optimize();
01535     return this;
01536 }

01539 Stmt *
01540 PrintStmt::TypeCheck() {
01541     if (values)

01543     return this;
